node.title: Covid-19 updates: Auckland inmates among positive cases
node.description: A small number of Covid-19 cases in Corrections custody in Auckland have been reported by the Ministry of Health.

node.title: Man accused of killing Elizabeth Zhong named
node.description: The man accused of murdering Auckland businesswoman Elizabeth Zhong can now be named.

node.title: Water discharging into sea not up to standard after treatment plant fire
node.description: Christchurch City Council says it is confident it can still do a "pretty good job" of treating sewage at the plant.

node.title: Flemington Racecourse welcomes back thousands of punters, fans for Melbourne Cup
node.description: The roses are in bloom, luxury dining precincts are stocked with champagne and the lawns will soon be scattered with punters as Flemington Racecourse welcomes back 10,000 revellers for the 2021…

node.title: New 'navigator' to reduce meth harm on the West Coast
node.description: A new 'navigator' role has been created on the West Coast to support people impacted by methamphetamine, police say.

node.title: Nine arrested, drugs and firearms seized in Timaru
node.description: Nine people have been charged with drug and firearm offences after police executed 10 search warrants in Timaru over the past three days.

node.title: France's President is calling Scott Morrison a liar. How did we get here?
node.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison has been called a liar by French President Emmanuel Macron while on the international stage. But did Mr Morrison mislead the French over his intentions on the submarine deal, or was the arrangement already dead in the water?

node.title: At least $38b in JobKeeper went to companies where turnover did not fall sufficiently
node.description: Analysis by the federal Parliamentary Budget Office found that $38 billion in JobKeeper payments went to employers that did not suffer sustained downturns below threshold levels.

node.title: Appeal over legality of 2020 Covid-19 lockdown dismissed
node.description: The Court of Appeal has dismissed private court action taken over the legality of last year's Covid-19 alert level 4 lockdown.

node.title: Anti-money laundering compliance firm rakes in $30m
node.description: A local anti-money laundering compliance firm has received strong backing from overseas investors, amid growing scrutiny on global tax havens and money laundering.

node.title: Biden Administration Moves to Limit Methane, a Potent Greenhouse Gas
node.description: A new rule will be announced at a U.N. summit where the United States is facing skepticism about its commitment to climate change, aides said.

node.title: Women's and Children's Hospital reveals number of unvaccinated staff, protesters gather in Adelaide CBD
node.description: The CEO of Adelaide's Women's and Children's Hospital reveals 133 staff have refused to be vaccinated against COVID-19 and have been forced to take leave. Meanwhile, dozens of anti-mandatory vaccination protesters rally in the CBD.

node.title: Georgia Secretary of State Says GOP Didn't 'Read the Tea Leaves' Ahead of Trump 2020 Loss
node.description: Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger blamed Republicans for assuming Trump would win the election despite signs pointing to it being a close race.

node.title: What caused Hobart's spooky Halloween sunset?
node.description: Trick or treaters across Hobart on Sunday saw an eerie sight in the evening sky that mirrored the spooky streets below. But the answer to what caused the strange clouds is fairly straightforward.

node.title: Incentivise red hot favourite for Melbourne Cup
node.description: Australian-bred stayer Incentivise will look to cap a golden spring with victory in the $8.4 million Melbourne Cup today as the runaway favourite in "the race that stops the nation".

node.title: Second man arrested following Auckland Domain gathering on Saturday
node.description: Police have arrested and charged a 57-year-old man with Failing to Comply with Order (Covid-19) over the event.

node.title: Former Ireland coach Joe Schmidt joins Blues for Super Ruby 2022
node.description: The former Ireland coach, New Zealander Joe Schmidt, will join the Blues coaching staff in a support role for the 2022 Super Rugby season.

node.title: Man who allegedly set ex-partner on fire likely used accelerant, court told
node.description: Medical experts have given evidence in the attempted murder trial of a man who allegedly set his partner alight, saying the pattern of her burns indicates an accelerant was used.

node.title: Ho ho ho turns to no no no as Queensland restrictions slay Santa bookings
node.description: A Santa hire business has copped a near 80 per cent drop in bookings as Queensland's COVID restrictions cast a pall over the holiday season.

node.title: Councillor calls for review of children's books about racism, gender identity
node.description: Anti-racism and LGBTQIA+ campaigners reject a Toowoomba councillor's calls to remove children's books discussing discrimination from library shelves.

node.title: Verry Elleegant secures the biggest win of her career, winning the Melbourne Cup
node.description: Despite never winning beyond 2400m going into the race, Verry Elleegant has secured the biggest win of her career with Melbourne Cup glory at Flemington.

node.title: Researcher refuses vaccines because he's had a dose of his own COVID-19 jab
node.description: An Adelaide medical researcher who has developed and been administered with his own COVID-19 vaccine says he is facing the sack because of his refusal to get one of the TGA-approved jabs.

node.title: Covid-19: 126 new community cases today
node.description: The Ministry of Health says of the 126 new community cases, 107 are in Auckland, 18 in Waikato, and one in Northland.

node.title: Here’s What to Watch in New York and New Jersey Elections
node.description: New York City will elect three citywide positions, while both the governor’s race in New Jersey and the mayor’s race in Buffalo could have national implications.

node.title: What to Watch in Tuesday’s Elections: Virginia, Mayor’s Races and Policing
node.description: The Virginia governor’s race will be closely studied for clues about the midterms, and new mayors will be chosen in New York, Boston, Buffalo, Atlanta and more.

node.title: COP26: Modi says India targets net zero emissions by 2070
node.description: India's prime minister used the COP26 climate talks to announce 2070 as the target for his country to reach net zero carbon emissions, two decades beyond what scientists say is needed to avert…

node.title: Bold fashion under blue skies at Flemington as crowds welcomed back for Melbourne Cup
node.description: For the first time since the COVID-19 pandemic began, thousands of Melbourne Cup fans descend on Flemington to watch in person the race that stops a nation.

node.title: While Australia throws open its international borders, WA residents watch from the sidelines
node.description: As international flights resume in other parts of the nation, West Australians are having to be patient, but the rumblings of discontent with the state's hard border stance are growing, writes Andrea Mayes.

node.title: Modi says it will take India until 2070 to hit net zero emissions and asks for $1 trillion
node.description: The world's third-biggest greenhouse gas emitter has pledged net zero emissions by 2070, decades beyond what scientists say is needed to avoid catastrophic climate change.

node.title: RBA concedes interest rates may lift sooner than 2024
node.description: The Reserve Bank has kept Australia's cash rate at the record low 0.1 per cent, for its 12th month in a row, but it has also abandoned one of its key COVID-19 stimulus measures.

node.title: Police working on opportunistic abductor theory in Cleo Smith disappearance as they track down more campers
node.description: Police believe missing four-year-old Cleo Smith was snatched by an opportunistic offender as they work to eliminate from the investigation more than 110 people who were camping nearby at the time.

node.title: Pfizer's ability to manufacture paediatric vaccines to meet demand will be a challenge - Bloomfield
node.description: Questions are being asked about when the government will firm up supplies of paediatric vaccines with an application from Pfizer due any day now.

node.title: Rev. Jesse Jackson hospitalized after falling and hitting his head
node.description: The statement said a CT scan and other tests "came back normal."

node.title: NZ Football cancels National League Championship
node.description: There won't be a national football champion this year, with New Zealand Football cancelling the women's and men's National League Championship series.

node.title: 'Joe Made a Mistake': Democrats Assail Manchin for Refusing to Back Spending Bill
node.description: Manchin said that Democrats were using "shell games and budget gimmicks" to hide the cost of the bill.

node.title: 'Trump Lost' Billboards Spring Up in Texas and Florida, Funded by GOP Group Against 'Audits'
node.description: The group behind the billboard "graded" Republican Congress members on whether they opposed Trump's baseless claims of election fraud. Most failed.

node.title: Tucker Carlson Slams Lindsey Graham Over 1/6 Comments: 'What The Hell's Wrong With You?'
node.description: "On January 6 Lindsey Graham was running around the Capitol, ordering the Capitol Police to murder the protesters," Carlson said.

node.title: Texas Medical Board Warns 'Demon Sperm' Doctor Over Prescribing Hydroxychloroquine to treat COVID
node.description: The doctor had previously touted the drug as a "cure" for COVID-19.

node.title: Squid Game-inspired cryptocurrency plunges to $0 in apparent scam
node.description: After surging by 310,000 per cent, the value of a cryptocurrency, based on the popular Netflix show Squid Game, has crashed to $0 in what is likely to have been a "rug pull" scam.

node.title: How our CBDs are likely to evolve post-COVID
node.description: With CBDs bearing the brunt of restrictions and working from home arrangements during the pandemic, experts say they may look different in the future.

node.title: 'Sovereign citizen' posts video after failing to appear in court on firearms offences
node.description: A warrant is issued for the arrest of a Barossa Valley woman after the "sovereign citizen" fails to appear in court for a second time.

node.title: RAAF's first F-35 display pilot ready to buzz air show at 60 metres
node.description: Flight Lieutenant Ross Bowman says when you plug in the afterburner of Australia's newest fighter jet, it's a struggle to keep his head off the headrest as it accelerates.

node.title: Frustration rising along with Wellington rental prices
node.description: Wellington renters are becoming increasingly angry with the poor state of many of the capital's flats as the city heads into the pre-Christmas flat-hunting season.

node.title: Dodgy accounting reveals govt emissions target less ambitious - lawyer
node.description: Climate activists say the government's pledge to halve emissions by 2030 vastly overstates the effect it will actually have.

node.title: Attack Left Flight Attendant With Concussion and Facial Injury, Authorities Say
node.description: The chief executive of American Airlines called the violent encounter on a California-bound flight from New York last week “one of the worst displays of unruly behavior we’ve ever witnessed.”

node.title: Texas Woman Accused of Pointing a Loaded Gun at Young Trick-or-Treater
node.description: On Monday, 35-year-old Monica Ann Bradford was apprehended and charged with aggravated assault with a deadly weapon, which is a second-degree felony.

node.title: COP26: The main issues and what role New Zealand plays
node.description: Explainer - More than 20,000 people have converged in Scotland for the massive UN climate meeting, which officially begins today. Hamish Cardwell examines the main issues, who will be there and how…

node.title: Review: Embodying Justice in ‘Twilight: Los Angeles, 1992’
node.description: Anna Deavere Smith’s one-woman play about the aftermath of the Rodney King case gets a cast of five in an updated Off Broadway revival.

node.title: Everything you need to know about the changes to NSW's COVID-19 rules
node.description: High vaccination rates mean NSW's COVID-19 roadmap is changing again — here's what you'll be able to do if you've had both jabs, and how long you'll have to wait if you haven't.

node.title: Jurors for Kyle Rittenhouse Trial Are Swiftly Selected
node.description: The judge pushed back against comments from potential jurors who said they had read and talked too much about the shootings that took place during unrest in Kenosha County, Wis.

node.title: ‘Maybe I Do Have a Story to Tell’: Kal Penn on His Memoir
node.description: The actor talks about his new book, “You Can’t Be Serious,” in which he introduces readers to his fiancé, Josh, and explains his sabbatical from Hollywood to work for the Obama administration.

node.title: Victorian Opposition Leader tells Liberal MP caught drink driving not to contest next election
node.description: Victorian Liberal leader Matthew Guy tells backbencher Tim Smith he should not contest his electorate of Kew next year, after Mr Smith crashed his car while more than twice over the legal blood-alcohol limit.

node.title: Government backs carbon capture technology despite it being 'three times the cost' of renewables
node.description: The Federal Government is relying on carbon capture and storage to help it meet its 2050 emissions targets – a trial proposed on Queensland's Western Downs could decide whether that plan will work.

node.title: Darwin shooter Benjamin Hoffmann pleads guilty to murder mid-trial
node.description: In week seven of his nine-week murder trial, Benjamin Hoffmann changes his plea from not guilty to guilty, admitting three counts of murder and one of manslaughter.

node.title: How does COP26 affect sport?
node.description: When world leaders meet in Glasgow this week to discuss the global response to climate change, sporting organisations will either be involved or looking on with interest.

node.title: Mets Fire Their Interim G.M. Two Months After His Arrest
node.description: Zack Scott was placed on leave on Sept. 1. He had been charged with driving while intoxicated.

node.title: We asked ABC readers what they thought about the Melbourne Cup. Here's what they told us
node.description: Crowds are back at Flemington this year, but ABC readers still have strong opinions on whether Cup Day is a good thing or a bad thing. Here's what they said.

node.title: "Rust" assistant director makes first public statement
node.description: Dave Halls handed Alec Baldwin the gun — which was believed to have been safe — before the fatal October 21 shooting, according to court documents filed last week.

node.title: AMA says vaping products are 'getting around' import ban
node.description: The Australian Medical Association's SA president says it's "scary" that schoolchildren are continuing to access vaping products with ease, despite an import ban coming into effect last month.

node.title: What Harry Styles Fans Wore for ‘Harryween’
node.description: His concert at Madison Square Garden over the weekend coincided with Halloween.

node.title: Two teenage girls accused of plotting to kill teacher at Perth high school
node.description: Detectives in Western Australia charge two teenage girls with attempting to kill a teacher who was stabbed at Willetton Senior High School yesterday.

node.title: Officer justified in use of force detaining young woman, IPCA finds
node.description: A police officer was justified using force to detain a young woman who had run away from hospital, the Independent Police Conduct Authority has found.

node.title: Fans in Brazil take frustrations out on VAR after disallowed goal
node.description: Fans of relegation-threatened Grêmio stormed the field and vented their frustrations on VAR after having a late goal ruled out for offside.

node.title: MPs question Parliament's additional isolation rule
node.description: With MPs in alert level 3 areas wanting to return to Parliament, Speaker of the House Trevor Mallard says discussions are ongoing about whether the rules will change.

node.title: Pasifika climate activist's message to COP: 'We are not drowning, we are fighting'
node.description: A New Zealand Pasifika climate activist has told the UN climate meeting that young Pacific people are not victims of climate change but beacons of hope.

node.title: Leaders Warn of Climate ‘Doomsday’ as Old Rifts Divide Summit’s First Day
node.description: The opening day of a climate summit was heavy on dire warnings and light on substantive proposals as leaders in Glasgow met to discuss a warming world.

node.title: Talking About ‘Attica,’ the Newest Documentary on the Prison Uprising
node.description: Fifty years after the fact, the filmmakers Stanley Nelson and Traci A. Curry reflect on the bloody standoff and what it accomplished.

node.title: Ohio Man Pleads Guilty to Requesting 'Military Training' From ISIS
node.description: "Don't thank me...it's my duty," Naser Almadaoji told an individual he believed to be a member of ISIS after translating a document from Arabic to English.

node.title: Zespri cuts the volume of gold kiwifruit licences on offer next March
node.description: Gold kiwifruit growers have had outstanding returns in recent years, on average receiving nearly $178,000 per hectare last season, but a handbrake is being put on future development.

node.title: Why NZ is spending $60 million getting to the Dubai Expo
node.description: The Detail - Expo 2020 kicked off in Dubai last month, with New Zealand predicted to get an eventual $313m benefit to its economy - a figure which may be revised upwards.

node.title: Mentally ill and shot in the back: The police killing of Jerrim Toms
node.description: Jerrim Toms' mum asked police to help her mentally ill son. They ended up shooting him as he ran away. Guyon Espiner investigates.

node.title: Police concerned about missing Central Otago man's well-being
node.description: Police are appealing for the public's help to find a missing Central Otago man.

node.title: Auckland councillor told to take safety precautions after threat from suspected anti-vaxxers
node.description: An Auckland councillor has been advised not to attend events alone and to stop using her car because it has her face and name on it after she was threatened by three men outside a vaccination centre… Audio

node.title: Huma Abedin on how Hillary Clinton weathered the Lewinsky scandal
node.description: After 25 years in the background, Abedin is now sharing what it was like to be with Clinton when the Lewinsky affair became public.

node.title: We Should All Know Less About Each Other
node.description: On social media, exposure to those unlike us often makes us hate them.

node.title: No, Vaccine Mandates Aren’t an Attack on Freedom
node.description: It's hard to imagine a worse case for defending personal choice.

node.title: Derrick Henry's Foot Surgery Stalls His MVP Campaign and Titans' Super Bowl Hopes
node.description: Tennessee won four consecutive games to move atop the AFC South and into Super Bowl consideration, but has lost the league's best running back.

node.title: India Hopes for New Defense Deals with Russia, Even Amid Growing Ties to U.S.
node.description: "It is always important for friends like India and Russia to have an additional level of consultations, an additional platform of consultations," India's outgoing envoy to Russia said.

node.title: 9,000 Unvaccinated N.Y.C. Workers Put on Unpaid Leave as Mandate Begins
node.description: Mayor Bill de Blasio said thousands more did get the shot and that the first day of the vaccine mandate went smoothly, without significant service disruptions.

node.title: RNC Chair Ronna McDaniel Says Terry McAuliffe Is 'Flailing' on Election Day Eve
node.description: "A lot of McAuliffe's problems are of his own making," McDaniel claimed ahead of the Virginia gubernatorial election.

node.title: PM pledges $500m to support Pacific nations dealing with climate change
node.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison pledges an extra half a billion dollars in support for Australia's Pacific and south-east Asian neighbours, grappling with the devastation wrought by climate change.

node.title: Victorian daily COVID cases dip below 1,000 for the first time in weeks
node.description: Victoria records 989 new local COVID-19 cases and nine deaths, the first time daily case numbers have been below 1,000 since September 28.

node.title: NSW fast tracks freedoms for fully vaccinated people, but bad news for those without COVID-19 jab
node.description: The NSW government has made significant changes to the state's COVID-19 roadmap, bringing forward new freedoms for fully vaccinated people and delaying privileges for those who've shunned the jab.

node.title: David Attenborough issues hopeful message at COP26, says humans are 'powerful enough to save' the planet
node.description: Sir David Attenborough tells world leaders he has witnessed a "terrible decline" during his lifetime, but the 95-year-old is confident that humans, "the greatest problem solvers to have ever existed on Earth", can oversee a "wonderful recovery".

node.title: Tropical Storm Wanda uses last storm name for the 2021 season
node.description: Forecasters will use additional list of names instead of the Greek alphabet for the first year ever.

node.title: Rivian edges closer to an I.P.O., seeking a valuation above $50 billion.
node.description: The company updated registration documents with the Securities and Exchange Commission on Monday.

node.title: Queen Elizabeth, calling for statesmanship, not politics, said ‘the time for action’ is now.
node.description: The 95-year-old monarch gave her address by video, after doctors advised her to rest and not go to the summit. Prince Charles attended and delivered a similar message.

node.title: 82% of Fox News, 97% of OANN, Newsmax Viewers Believe Trump's Stolen Election Claim: Poll
node.description: The poll also found that Republicans surveyed believed violence could be necessary to solve the issues facing America.

node.title: Thailand welcomes first international tourists as Bangkok-based Australians plan Christmas homecomings
node.description: As Thailand allows its first visitors in 18 months to skip hotel quarantine, Bangkok-based Australians are looking to take advantage of the relaxing of restrictions and opening of borders to be reunited with loved ones.

node.title: 'Forcible touching' charge against Collingwood player Jordan De Goey dropped
node.description: US prosecutors drop a charge of "forcible touching", but Jordan De Goey still faces assault charges after being accused of punching and kicking a 37-year-old man in New York.

node.title: Shaw wary of climate conference, defends govt emissions plan
node.description: Climate Minister James Shaw is not looking forward to attending the massive UN climate conference where he will have to do battle with the large polluting countries. Audio

node.title: Tova O'Brien leaving Newshub to join MediaWorks
node.description: Tova O'Brien is leaving her role as Newshub's political editor, having signed on as the breakfast host on MediaWorks' newly announced talk radio brand.

node.title: A Nourishing Filipino-Inspired Soup for Fall
node.description: To celebrate the publication of ‘Filipinx,’ their new cookbook, the chef Angela Dimayuga and the writer Ligaya Mishan made nilaga.

node.title: Rodney Reed Should Not Be Retried in Texas Murder Case, Judge Says
node.description: The judge said that new evidence, including witness testimony, was not sufficient to warrant a new trial for Mr. Reed, who was sentenced to death in the 1996 murder of a 19-year-old woman.

node.title: Mother Arrested on Suspicion of Murdering Newborn Found Abandoned in Trashcan in Winter
node.description: An autopsy confirmed that the infant had not been a stillbirth and had been alive when it was abandoned.

node.title: 'Bad for America': Trump Says World Leaders 'Laughing' at Biden' on President's Europe Trip
node.description: "We have never been thought of so poorly as we are right now...So low and so bad for America. There has never been a time like it," Trump said in a statement.

node.title: Robert Durst indicted for second-degree murder in wife's 1982 disappearance
node.description: The Westchester County District Attorney convened a grand jury to review the murder in the second degree charge after a complaint was filed last week

node.title: Potentially faster-spreading Delta variant, AY.4.2, spotted in 8 states
node.description: New data from the U.K. suggests vaccines remain effective against the coronavirus variant sometimes called "Delta plus."

node.title: Jurors Who Convicted Derek Chauvin Are Identified for First Time
node.description: A judge also released questionnaires that the jurors had filled out before they were selected for the trial, which ended with Mr. Chauvin being imprisoned for murdering George Floyd.

node.title: U.S. Distillers Celebrate End to Retaliatory Tariffs in E.U., Look to Make Up For Lost Revenue
node.description: The tariffs targeted American whiskey and other U.S. products in response to former President Donald Trump's imposed tariffs on European steel and aluminum.
